DataElement.preferredName: Laboratory Procedure Serum Glutamic Oxaloacetic Transferase Result Lower Limit of Normal Value
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the lowest level of normal value, unit of measure not specified, for the medical procedure that involves testing a sample of blood for serum glutamic-oxalacetic transaminase, pyridoxal phosphate-dependent enzymes involved in amino acid metabolism and in the urea and tricarboxylic acid cycles.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Laboratory Procedure Serum Glutamic Oxaloacetic Transferase Result
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the result of a medical procedure that involves testing a sample of blood for serum glutamic-oxalacetic transaminase, pyridoxal phosphate-dependent enzymes involved in amino acid metabolism and in the urea and tricarboxylic acid cycles.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A procedure for critical evaluation; a means of determining the presence, quality, or truth of something.

Concepts.definition: Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.

Property.preferredDefinition: Activity measured as a test of liver function, 46/47-kDa homodimeric human Aspartate Aminotransferases (Class-I Pyridoxal-Phosphate-Dependent Aminotransferase Family) are pyridoxal phosphate-dependent enzymes involved in amino acid metabolism and in the urea and tricarboxylic acid cycles. (NCI):Outcome; a phenomenon that follows and is caused by some previous phenomenon.

Concepts.definition: A family of pyridoxal phosphate-dependent enzymes involved in amino acid metabolism and in the urea and tricarboxylic acid cycles. Aspartate aminotransferase specifically and reversibly catalyzes the transfer of an amino group from L-aspartate to alpha-ketoglutarate forming oxaloacetate and L-glutamate.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Serum Glutamic Oxaloacetic Transferase Lab Unspecified Lower Limit of Normal Value
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: a numeric laboratory value, unit of measure not specified, representing the lower level of the normal range of SGOT or AST in peripheral blood serum used to comparatively reference the patient's lab result.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Not stated explicitly or in detail.:The bottom of the normal range for a particular laboratory result.:A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

Concepts.definition: Not stated explicitly or in detail.

The lowest value of the range of statistical characteristics that are supposed to represent accepted standard, non-pathological pattern for particular laboratory result or other quantitative parameter.
A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

DataElement.origin: RTOG CRF:Radiation Therapy Oncology Group Case Report Form
